page.title: 20SHEFFIELD PARK GARDEN
page.content: In 1264 Simon de Montfort held the manor of Sifelle ( Sheffield ) After his death at Evesham in 1265 Henry 3 gave it to William Bardolph a loyal royalist. The succeeding 500 years saw various tenants and owners. In 1769 John Baker Holroyd, later first Earl of Sheffield, bought it and is remembered as close friend of Edward Gibbon (son of The Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire was written here). Capability Brown laid out the gardens for John Holroyd. They now cover about 100 acres set around 5 lakes and contain a very fine collection of trees and flowering shrubs-autumn colours are splendid. The National Trust now own the gardens which are open most days April to mid-November. House only by special arrangement. {D Skan
